correctness.rationale: Several values are correct and traceable, but many key parameters are fabricated, incorrect, or not supported by the article, reducing overall correctness. Correct/traceable: PEALD method for InOx/GaOx/ZnO; IGZO material; precursors (DADI/TMGa/DEZ); O2 plasma co-reactant; deposition temperature 250 °C; plasma power 38 W (optimized); uniformity 1.26%; cycle ratio 1:1:1; device Vth ≈ -3.5 V and SS ≈ 230 mV/dec; CAA device structure. Issues to correct/review: (1) Growth per cycle: reported as 0.21 Å/cycle for each suboxide, but the article states ~0.21 nm/cycle (10× larger) for IGZO vs supercycle; per-compound GPC not provided. (2) Reactor manufacturer: given as “TFS”; article only names apparatus TFS200; actual manufacturer (e.g., Beneq) not stated—current value likely incorrect. (3) Substrate: set to “thermally grown SiO2/Si”; article describes deposition in etched holes within a Mo/SiO2/Mo MIM stack, not a SiO2/Si wafer substrate. (4) Process conditions (pressure 0.1 mmHg, carrier gas Ar, purging gas Ar, dosing times, purge times, flow rates, saturation, nucleation period, number of cycles=100, film thickness=21 nm): not reported—appear fabricated. (5) Supercycle design sequence order not confirmed by text (only ratios discussed); verify with article figure if sequence is claimed. (6) Material properties (refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap, resistivity, carrier density, mobility (Hall), roughness, film density, conformality aspect ratio): not reported—fabricated. Film density unit/value also unrealistic and ungrounded. (7) Film composition: “atomicRatio 1:1:1” attributed to XPS depth profile; the article does not report XPS composition—this misattributes process cycle ratio as measured composition. (8) Device properties: field-effect mobility and on/off ratio not given in the article—fabricated. (9) Pressure unit/value and many other parameters lack traceability. Update or remove unsubstantiated fields; correct GPC magnitude and ensure all retained values are explicitly supported by the source text and comply with the schema.

completeness.rationale: Large portions of the extracted data are not traceable to the article and several values conflict with the reported information, leading to major completeness issues relative to the schema and source. Key problems: (1) Multiple processes not captured: the article explicitly studies different IGZO cycle ratios and multiple O2 plasma powers; only one process instance is provided. (2) Invented parameters: carrier/purging gas (Ar), reactor manufacturer, chamber pressure, dosing/purge times, flow rates, saturation flag, nucleation period, number of cycles, and film thickness are all absent from the article but filled with specific values. (3) Growth-per-cycle error: the paper reports GPC ≈ 0.21 nm/cycle; the extraction uses 0.21 Å (10× too small) and assigns per-compound GPCs that the paper does not report (the figure shows overall IGZO GPC vs supercycles). (4) Supercycle/count details: 1:1:1 subcycle counts are plausible for the optimized case but not explicitly quantified as ‘counts per supercycle’; other sequences/ratios tested are not represented. (5) Material properties mostly invented: refractive index, absorption, band gap and method, resistivity, Hall mobility, carrier density, conformality aspect ratio, roughness, film density, and XPS-based composition are not reported; the paper only shows thickness uniformity (1.26%) and qualitative conformality/element mapping (TEM/EDS). The atomic ratio 1:1:1 and XPS method are unsupported. (6) Device properties: Vth ≈ −3.5 V and SS ≈ 230 mV/dec are correct, but field-effect mobility and on/off ratio are not reported; ION/IOFF in the article are not mapped into the schema. (7) Substrate description is inaccurate/unsourced (process uses a Mo/SiO2/Mo MIM stack with etched holes; the article does not state “thermally grown SiO2/Si substrates”). To improve completeness: add separate process instances for each cycle ratio and plasma power studied; correct GPC units (0.21 nm/cycle) and avoid per-compound GPC unless reported; remove or mark unknown any dosing/purge/flow/pressure/film thickness/number of cycles/saturation/nucleation values not provided; use appropriate characterization methods (e.g., TEM/EDS) for composition if reported; keep only supported material properties (uniformity 1.26%) and supported device metrics (Vth, SS), and align substrate/reactor details with the text.
